in.teramatrix.flint.driver.controller

Class LocationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • in.teramatrix.flint.driver.controller.LocationService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener

    public class LocationService
extends android.app.Service
implements com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    It's the main location service that runs in background and send location update to the server in a little duration. Duration has been stored in shared preferences that can be changed anytime. To apply changes, you need to restart this service again because Location provider has been initialized in onCreate() of this service. To restart the service, just stop it using stopService() because in onDestroy() of this service, this service is started again. It will be started automatically. In case of logout only, this service will be destroyed completely.

    This services uses Google's fused location api to get current location of device that is more powerful approach than traditional GPS and NETWORK providers.

    To keep our location service alive in less resource condition, this service is structured as a foreground service. It mean, A notification will always be in Notification Panel of the device.
    Author:
    mohsin.khan
    Date:
    11/21/2016

      (package private) class  LocationService.NetworkReceiver
      This class will received broadcast if user connects/disconnects to the internet Note : Please ensure all the records will be updated to the server within connection/write timeout
